creator: pierre42d@9online.fr
text:
# ./configure       
checking build system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking host system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking target system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking for a BSD-compatible install... /usr/local/bin/install -c
checking for working mkdir -p... yes
APR-util Version: 1.1.2
checking for chosen layout... apr-util
Applying apr-util hints file rules for i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking for APR... no
configure: error: APR could not be located. Please use the --with-apr option.


Why can't it be located ? I installed it to the default location.

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
I believe APR-Util requires --with-apr to ALWAYS be passed, and does not search
any directories besidess '../apr' for the APR install/source.
